answers.answer: The important issues is that the TSH is down after starting levothyroxin.  It is suggested to redo the test 6 weeks after the first one to see if both correspond or thereabouts, before a med. dose adjustment. If so might be able to tweak the doses to bring TSH down a little, which should bring up the FT-4 a little as well.I have read from others who had a TSH of 300 and 400.The goiter and cyst needs to be properly tested.  Make sure the endo. is a thyroid specialist.  Most deal in diabetes with thyroid being way down their list of expertise.Good Luck to the both of you.

Good to see that Ashlee's TSH has come down so much.  Hopefully she is feeling a lot better than she was.  Keep us posted on how she is doing and what they find out about the goiter and cyst.God be with you both.Dac

question: I just  picked up my daughters lab report today.The first time she was tested it was:Free T4 0.37        Range 0.61-1.12TSH 52.55           Range 0.37-5.60After starting levothyroxineFree T4 0.71           same rangeTSH 6.27                 same rangeCould someone please help explain to me what all this means. They say she is hypothyroid, and she has goiter and cyst and also has appt. with endo. It seems like 52.55 is insanely high?
title: Help Reading Daughters Labs
